ygData.subject: RE: dual weild
ygData.msgSnippet: It s strange, some skills just seem to appear when you hit the right level. I remember when I hit 17 (well the 2nd time I hit 17) I ran to the guild hall to
ygData.messageBody:
It's strange, some skills just seem to appear when you hit the right level.
I remember when I hit 17 (well the 2nd time I hit 17) I ran to the guild
hall to train only to find I already had the skill at a respectable level
(ie there was a coin cost to train in it). I saw the same thing with my
shadow knight the other day. He hit 9th went to go train his spell skills
and already had channeling at about skill 30 I believe. And it went up just
fine without putting a point into it.

Rokenn

>From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] dual weild
>Date: Wed, 17 Nov 1999 13:18:20 -0500
>
>like many skills (e.g. warrior's double attack) i thought we had to put 1
>skill point into duel wield to learn the basics. could be wrong though
>hehe.
>
>Shada
>
> >
> > One final note on DW, is you need to place no skill points in
> > it at all for
> > it to go up. You get it free at 17th level.
> >
> >
> > Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
>
